H0.text: What is the only novel to top the best-seller lists for two consecutive years. To Kill a Mockingbird

H1.text: What is the only novel to top the best-seller lists for two consecutive years. The Da Vinci Code

H2.text: What is the only novel to top the best-seller lists for two consecutive years. The Catcher in the Rye

H3.text: What is the only novel to top the best-seller lists for two consecutive years. Livingston Seagull

A4.text: In 1972 and 1973, the book topped the Publishers Weekly list of bestselling novels in the United States.

A5.text: The book was a sleeper hit; the first edition in 1970 was only 3,000 copies and it would take two years before reaching number one on the New York Times Bestseller List.
